description.text:
*Overview*
*Title:* _Carriers Wanted — Semi & Hotshot Dispatch + Government Contract Setup (We Get Paid When You Get Paid)_

*Description:*
Tired of dispatchers who don’t prioritize you, don’t communicate clearly, or treat you like just another truck number?
KBTB Management is a carrier-centered logistics management company designed to support *semi and hotshot carriers* with real consistency and *government contract opportunities*.

*What We Provide:*
✓ Dedicated English-speaking dispatcher
✓ We ONLY get paid *when you get paid*
✓ Preferred lane booking for semis and hotshots
✓ Strong rate negotiation
✓ Back-office support: carrier packets, broker packets, invoicing, compliance
✓ *Full government contracting setup* (FEMA, DOT, state & local)
✓ No robots. No call centers. Real human communication.

*We Work With:*
✔ Semi-Trucks
✔ Hotshot Carriers
✔ New Authorities Welcome

*Why Carriers Choose KBTB:*

* You’re treated like a partner, not a truck number
* Transparent communication
* Access to contracting opportunities + high-paying lanes
* We run your truck like it’s our investment

If you’re a semi or hotshot carrier ready for consistent freight, real support, and contract-ready growth — *apply now*. dispatch@kbtbmanagement.com or call kay @(323)927-2086

Pay: $60,000.00 - $154,657.29 per year

Benefits:
* Fuel card
* Referral program



Application Question(s):
* Do you have an MC Number?
* What Type of Equipment do you have?
* Do you need a dispatcher?
* What is your MC Number?
* Are you interested in government loads?
* What's a great number to reach you?

Work Location: On the road

description.text:
SUMMARY: Responsible for dispatching Officers to calls, distribution of information, logging of events, and the operation of non-gaming surveillance equipment.

Essential Responsibilities and Duties: (Specific areas of responsibility including, but not limited to)

Operates dispatch and surveillance equipment.
Coordinates response to calls and emergency situations.
Facilitates the flow of information by attending daily shift pass downs.
Ensures proper notifications are made in regard to emergency situations, or as directed.
Enters accurate data into computer-aided dispatching systems (CAD).
Develops reports from information gathered from various reporting systems.
Conducts video reviews and investigates incidents.
Maintains a working knowledge of departmental policy and procedures.
Assists Public Safety Officers as directed.
Other duties as assigned.

Mandatory Requirements:

Must possess a high school diploma, G.E.D., or equivalent.
Excellent communication skills required.
Ability to type 30 words per minute.
Must be computer literate and familiar with various computer applications.
Ability to learn new computer software.
Ability to read and comprehend documents such as safety rules, operation and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals.
Must be able to read electronic display panels on devices such as radios, cellular telephones, alarm systems, public address systems, etc.
Must be familiar with all applicable laws, rules, and regulations governing the Casino.
Must be familiar with Public Safety Department Policies and Procedures and have passed the training program within the introductory period.
Must be knowledgeable of Public Safety Officer duties.
Must be able to keep up with fast-paced atmosphere and work under pressure.
Ability to write routine reports and correspondence.
Must be able to multi-task, prioritize, understand and retain information communicated via radio, email, telephone, or in person.
Must be able to communicate using fixed or portable 2-way radios, land line, or cellular telephone.
Must be at least 21 years of age.
Must be able to obtain a valid gaming license.
Must be able to pass a mandatory drug test.
Must provide evidence of employment eligibility in the U.S.
Must be able to communicate proficiently in English.

Physical Demands:

Must be able to lift and push/pull at least 50 pounds and occasionally more with assistance.
Must have visual acuity of 20/20 with corrective lenses.
Must be physically able to perform all job requirements including intricate manipulation of controls, walking, standing, bending, and reaching.

Work Environment:

May be required to wear protective equipment such as mask, earplugs, gloves, eyewear, weather gear, etc.
Must be able to work in a non-smoke free environment.
Must be able to work in a noisy environment.
Must be able to work outside in all weather conditions.
Required to work around moving machinery with possible exposure to vibration, dust, gas, steam or chemicals.
Potential exposure to hostile situations.
Required to walk on uneven ground.
Must be able to work flexible hours, weekends, holidays, and special events.

employer.name: TCI Transportation
employer.briefDescription: TCI Transportation offers dedicated transportation, yard spotting, 3PL and brokerage service, expedited LTL freight movement, and truckload transportation throughout the lower 48 states.

description.text:
Join the TCI Team as a Dispatcher – $21/Hour | PM Shift (Tues/Wed OFF)

Are you an experienced dispatcher ready to take your career to the next level with a company that values safety, service, and professional growth? TCI Logistics is seeking a dependable and driven Dispatcher to support and manage our day-to-day transportation operations. This is your opportunity to work with a team that keeps logistics running smoothly—and safely.

Position Overview

As a Dispatcher at TCI, you'll play a critical role in coordinating transportation services across our operations. You'll work closely with drivers, dispatchers, mechanics, and other departments to ensure trips are covered, schedules are met, and compliance is maintained—all while delivering exceptional customer service.

Key Responsibilities
Coordinate daily operations including dispatching and adjusting driver assignments as needed.
Ensure safety is always the #1 priority.
Monitor and audit Hours of Service (HOS) for compliance.
Work with recruiting and training teams to support new driver onboarding and orientations.
Support equipment logistics, maintenance scheduling, and terminal safety activities.
Oversee customer service standards, meeting and exceeding performance goals.
Maintain clear communication with internal teams and external partners.
Organize and lead driver meetings and contribute to a culture of safety and accountability.
️ Skills & Qualifications
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Strong attention to detail and ability to multitask.
Familiarity with DOT compliance and HOS regulations.
Ability to lead by example and work as part of a collaborative team.
High level of ethics and confidentiality.
Experience in dispatch or logistics is strongly preferred.
Shift Details
Schedule: Thursday-Monday
Shift: Thurs-Fri & Sun-Mon: 4:00pm-2:00am; Sat: 12:30pm-8:30pm
Please note: During initial training, hours may fluctuate
Compensation
Hourly Rate: $21/hour

description.text:
Accelerate your career at Pulse Final Mile, a leading provider of transportation solutions with cutting- edge technology at the core. At Pulse Final Mile, we are customer-centric and strive to deliver the difference, one customer, one home, and one delivery at a time.

*Job Description:*

As a Customer Service Representative (CSR) at Pulse Final Mile, you will play a pivotal role in providing support to home delivery services for key clients and local operations. This fast-paced position requires a skilled professional capable of dispatching delivery teams, maintaining positive customer relationships, and driving operational efficiency while directly supporting our clients’ customers.

Responsibilities:

· Coordinate effective communication flow between Network Carrier Partners (NCPs), customers, clients, and Pulse representatives.

· Provide on-site warehouse support daily to ensure carrier teams adhere to client SOW procedures.

· Act as a local Pulse representative within the market, fostering a positive image and ensuring adherence to Pulse standards and operating procedures, while upholding the Pulse culture and values.

· Ensure compliance with specified contract metrics and terms.

· Maintain high standards for all operational activities.

· Support contract drivers and customers daily.

· Monitor routes and provide all interested parties with updates related to delivery orders and escalations.

· Handle inbound and outbound calls throughout the scheduled shift.

· Conduct truck check-in and loadout throughout the week.

· Update various reports and trackers.

· Conduct inventory audits or dock checks.

· Provide world-class customer service.

Requirements:

· 1+ years of customer service experience.

· Experience with Microsoft Office (Excel and Outlook preferred).

· Excellent communication skills.

· Schedule flexibility.

· Positive attitude.

*Job Type: *Full-Time, Non-Exempt

Benefits:

· 401(k)

· Dental insurance

· Health insurance

· Paid time off

· Vision insurance

Schedule:

· Based on market requirements and needs.

· Holiday availability.

· Weekend availability.

Supplemental Pay Types:

· N/A

Ability to Commute/Relocate:

· Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required).

*Work Location: *In person

Pulse Final Mile is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $18.00 - $20.00 per hour

Benefits:
* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Professional development assistance
* Vision insurance

Work Location: In person

description.text:
JOB
IMPORTANT INFORMATION: All applicants MUST submit a typing certificate for at least 35NWPM. Typing certificates obtained online WILL NOT be accepted. Typing certificates must also not be older than two (years) from the close of the recruitment. Applicants who do not submit the required typing certificate will not move forward in the recruitment process.Applicants may obtain a typing certificate through Worknet in Los Banos; (209) 710-6140.Qualified applicants will be contacted once the recruitment closes.DEFINITIONTo receive and transmit emergency and non-emergency calls from the public for police, fire and other City services; to prioritize calls and dispatch police, fire, or other emergency units as appropriate; to process and maintain a variety of departmental reports, records and files; to search inmates; and to monitor and assist in jail operations. SUPERVISION RECEIVED AND EXERCISEDReceives direction from the Dispatch Supervisor and/or Police Administrators.

EXAMPLE OF DUTIES
EXAMPLES OF ESSENTIAL DUTIESDuties may include, but are not limited to, the following: Reliable and dependable attendance and punctuality.Receive emergency and non-emergency calls from the public requesting police, fire, or other related services; determine nature and location of emergency; determine priority and dispatch emergency units as necessary and in accordance with established procedures; coordinate emergency calls and relay information and assistance requests involving other law enforcement agencies.Use a computer-aided dispatch (CAD) system to enter calls for service/radio traffic and monitor real-time status of situations.Maintain status and contact with all units on assignment and monitor radio frequencies of outside public safety agencies.Enter, retrieve, and update information from teletype networks, including the California Law Enforcement Telecommunications System (CLETS) related to wants and warrants and vehicle registration.Perform a variety of clerical duties including typing police reports, entering and retrieving data relating to confidential information about persons and property, confirming warrants, entering teletypes, clearing, locating and entering records.Monitor closed circuit television system and alarm panel.Search inmates, perform jail checks and feed prisoners.Update manuals to ensure accuracy and compliance with State and Federal laws.Build and maintain positive working relationships with co-workers, other City employees and the public using principles of good customer service.Train newly assigned personnel.Provide testimony in court related to assigned duties.Perform other related duties as assigned. Knowledge of: Operations, services, and activities of a modern public safety telecommunications and dispatch center.Call taking and dispatch techniques and protocols used in public safety telecommunications and dispatching activities.Customer service principles and practices.Principles and practices of record keeping and filing.Correct English usage, spelling, punctuation, and grammar.Modern office procedures, methods, and computer equipment.Principles and practices of work safety. Ability to: Communicate clearly and concisely, both orally and in writing.Answer and prioritize calls for emergency services and dispatch appropriate units in response.Perform multiple cognitive and manual tasks simultaneously.Effectively communicate and maintain composure with and elicit information from upset and irate citizens.Intermittently review documents related to dispatching operations; observe, identify and problem solve incidents while dispatching, remember, understand, interpret and explain operational policies and procedures to the public and staff.Operate dispatch, teletype and other computer programs and equipment related to public safety communications and records.On a continuous basis, sit at desk/console for long periods of time; intermittently, twist and reach office equipment; write or use keyboard to communicate through written means; verbally give instructions to officers in the field; monitor and hear officer's responses over the radio; and lift and carry weight of 10 pounds or less.Remain calm, speak clearly, listen and determine appropriate course of action while dealing with multiple emergency situationsAnalyze situations and determine effective courses of action; learn to adjust quickly to changing situations and assign reasonable priorities to incoming calls.Interpret and apply laws, ordinances, and departmental policies and procedures.Preserve confidentiality of sensitive material routinely encountered as part of work assignment.Establish and maintain effective interpersonal relationships with co-workers and members of the public.Exercise independent judgment and work with a minimum of supervision.Operate a variety of office equipment such as a copier, calculator, computer and typewriter.Type at a speed necessary for adequate job performance (35 NWPM).Learn and effectively use standard broadcasting procedures.Safely and effectively search prisoners.Monitor prisoners in a jail setting and to perform emergency first aid.Work rotating shift assignments.

employer.name: Dollar Tree
employer.briefDescription: Dollar Tree is headquartered in Chesapeake, VA, and we operate 9,000+ stores across the 48 contiguous states and five Canadian provinces.

description.text:
Pay Rate: $20-$25/ hour

Hours: Monday - Friday 6am - 2:30pm

General Summary

Coordinates outbound shipments to support transportation operations. Ensures timely, accurate communication and coordination across stores, distribution centers, carriers, and internal teams to maintain service standards and operational efficiency.

Key Responsibilities

Coordinate outbound and backhaul freight assignments to maximize truck utilization and reduce costs.
Monitor carrier performance and ensure compliance with delivery protocols.
Perform accurate data entry across transportation systems and ensure accuracy of carrier invoicing within those systems.
Conduct tracking and tracing of deliveries and equipment.
Support claims processes and ensure proper documentation for credits.
Analyze operational trends and implement process improvements.
Follow safety procedures and promote a clean, organized work environment.
Adhere to company policies and perform other duties as assigned.

Qualifications

Education: High school diploma or equivalent required; some college preferred.
Experience: 3–5 years of customer service experience preferred. Familiarity with DOT regulations and driver hours of service is a plus.
Skills: Proficient in MS Office Suite (Excel, Word, and PowerPoint)

Physical & Working Conditions

Ability to perform essential job functions with or without reasonable accommodation, including lifting, walking, standing, climbing, stooping, and kneeling.
Primarily office-based in a climate-controlled environment, with occasional exposure to warehouse conditions and regulated materials.

Availability

Must be willing to work shift hours, overtime, weekends, and holidays as needed.

Core Competencies

Communication: Clear, professional verbal and written communication; active listening; conflict resolution.
Customer Focus: Delivers high-quality service; builds trust and strong relationships.
Job Knowledge: Applies business and industry knowledge effectively; continuously improves performance.
Problem Solving & Decision Making: Identifies root causes; implements effective solutions; takes accountability.
Quality & Safety Awareness: Maintains accuracy and attention to detail; prioritizes safety.
Relationship Management: Collaborates across teams; supports others; values team success.
Reliability & Results Orientation: Dependable; takes initiative; drives toward measurable outcomes.

Full time

1122 Runway Drive,Stockton,California 95206

Transportation

Dollar Tree

employer.briefDescription: Penske Truck Leasing Co. is a leading global transportation services provider that operates approximately 440,000+ vehicles.

description.text:
Position Summary:

Responsible for the daily/weekly maintaining of pallet tracking (where applicable), audit of driver logs and trip reports, log and driver file DOT requirements tracking. Liaison for internal customer support. Track all return goods as directed by the customer for close out of returns from the private fleet.

Pay: $20.60/hr

Schedule: Thursday - Saturday & e/o Wednesday 7pm-7am

Additional Benefits:

• Paid Time Off

• Medical Insurance

• Dental Insurance

• Vision Insurance

• Life Insurance

• 401K

• Associate Referral Program

Major Responsibilities:

• Various office and administrative duties, database and miscellaneous reporting, answering phones, assisting customer service and drivers with their routes.

• Audit driver arrival times, maintain of files, customer service interaction, resolution of driver equipment requests and pallet tracking.

• Maintenance and distribution of route trip summaries, daily interface with drivers,

• Involve Safety team as required by location

• Prioritize workload and have flexibility to adjust based on position requirements

• Ability to maintain confidentiality is essential

• Ability to work in a team environment

• Other projects and tasks assigned by supervisor

Qualifications:

• 2 years of general office experience required

• 1 year of customer service experience required

employer.name: Safeway
employer.briefDescription: Safeway is a national grocery store chain that merged with Albertson's in 2015, now one of the largest food and drug retailers in the US.

description.text:
Why choose us?

Are you ready to take the next step in your career? Join us for an exciting opportunity at Albertsons Companies, where innovation and customer service go hand-in-hand!

At Albertsons Companies, we are looking for someone who’s not just seeking a job, but someone who wants to make an impact. In this role, you’ll have the opportunity to lead, innovate, and contribute to the growth of a company that values great service and lasting customer relationships. This position offers the chance to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment that’s constantly evolving.

What you will be doing

Safeway Tracy CA Distribution Center has an opening for a Transportation Supervisor.

Main responsibilities:

Communicating to the work force ways to promote a safe work environment.
Implement cost-saving measures through working closely with drivers’ dispatchers and software vendors.
Managing equipment and manpower requirements for daily operational needs
Monitoring employees' daily work assignments and spearheading safety initiatives for the department.

We are looking for candidates who possess the following:

2-year college degree, Bachelors preferred or 2 to 5 years of proven supervisory experience
Strong knowledge of Department of Transportation laws and regulations
Knowledge of HOS and Dispatching routing systems, MOBI and Prospero experience are a plus
Familiar with a union work environment and time and attendance procedures and requirements
Excellent oral and written communication skills
Possess transportation experience including loading of trailers and store delivery procedures.
Experience driving diesel-powered tractors and current CDL helpful.

Schedule:
Nights
Weekend availability a must

We also provide a variety of benefits including:

Competitive wages paid weekly
Associate discounts
Health and financial well-being benefits for eligible associates (Medical, Dental, 401k and more!)
Time off (vacation, holidays, sick pay). For eligibility requirements please visit myACI Benefits
Leaders invested in your training, career growth and development
An inclusive work environment with talented colleagues who reflect the communities we serve

Our Values – Click below to view video: ACI Values

The salary range is $70,000 to $78,000 annually. Starting salary will vary based on criteria such as location, experience, and qualifications. There may be flexibility for exceptional candidates.

A copy of the full job description can be made available to you. #LI-TM1

Albertsons Companies is at the forefront of the revolution in retail. Committed to innovation and fostering a culture of belonging, our team is united with a unique purpose: to bring people together around the joys of food and to inspire well-being. We want talented individuals to be part of this journey!

Locally great and nationally strong, Albertsons Companies (NYSE: ACI) is a leading food and drug retailer in the U.S. We operate over 2,200 stores, 1,732 pharmacies, 405 fuel centers, 22 distribution facilities, and 19 manufacturing plants across 34 states and the District of Columbia. Our well-known banners include Albertsons, Safeway, Vons, Jewel-Osco, ACME, Shaw’s, Tom Thumb, United Supermarkets, United Express, Randalls, Albertson’s Market, Pavilions, Star Markets, Market Street, Carrs, Haggen, Lucky, Amigos, Andronico’s Community Markets, King’s, Balducci’s, and Albertson’s Market Street.

Our vision is to be a retail leader admired for national strength with deep local roots, offering an easy, fun, friendly, and inspiring experience, no matter how customers choose to shop with us. We celebrate the rich diversity of the communities we serve, and strive to create a workplace where everyone has equal access to opportunities and resources, and can fully contribute to their and our company’s success.

Bring your flavor

Building the future of food and well-being starts with you. Join our team and bring your best self to the table.

Disclaimer

The above statements are intended to describe the general nature of work performed by the employees assigned to this job and are not the official job description for the position. All employees must comply with Company, Division, and Store policies and applicable laws. The responsibilities, duties, and skills of personnel may vary within store and/or from store to store and the official job description will be provided during the application process.

Albertsons is an Equal Opportunity Employer

This Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, gender, ethnicity, religion, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, gender identity/expression, sexual orientation, or on any other basis prohibited by law. Consistent with applicable state and local law, the Company will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

We endeavor to make this site accessible to any and all users. If you would like to contact us regarding the accessibility of our website or need assistance completing the application process, please contact us at 1-888-255-2269(option #4).

description.text:
Central Station Dispatcher - Swift Shift

Timing: 2:00pm to 10:30pm.

Position Overview:
The Central Station Dispatcher is the initial contact for dispatching emergency and non‐ emergency resources (public safety, alarm company personnel, responsible parties) and is responsible for managing the flow of incident related information to and from said resources. This position reports to the Central Station Manager/Central Station Assistant Manager/Shift Supervisor. The Central Station Dispatcher may be assigned additional tasks or duties by the Central Station Shift Supervisor and/or Central Station Manager and Assistant Manager.

Key duties & Responsibilities:
Please note the essential functions may vary depending on department size, organizational structure and/or geographic location.
Receive information from multiple sources requiring dispatch of emergency and/or non‐emergency resources.
Exhibit the knowledge to competently process alarm conditions as received, processing highest priority alarms first. Alarms will be processed consistently in accordance with departmental policy as outlined in GCS Training Guide and/or written memos or procedures.
Enter, update, and monitor the status of incidents via DICE, Immix by SureView or Frontel.
Properly, politely and diplomatically communicate necessary information to subscribers, emergency agencies, responsible persons, and the alarm companies using GCS approved customer service skills and phraseology or script.
Qualified to input a basic, uncomplicated account into DICE.
Receive and interpret verbal and written instructions to create new accounts. Receive temporary information changes from subscribers and Alarm Companies. Enter received data into the account file or forward information to data entry personnel for input.
Understand all of the operations of DICE alarm monitoring software in accordance with granted level of access. 1. Completing alarm events; manual alarm generation, creating, printing and completing service tickets, viewing reports of history. 2. Searching for accounts; placing accounts on test, writing account notes, entering O/C temporary schedules, viewing accounts and dealer accounts, exiting DICE. 3. Edit/Update Accounts: change account numbers, print/fax/email reports, dictate, compose, and complete edit requests.
Maintain filing or scanning of account paperwork. Working in conjunction with appropriate guidelines and procedures for filing and/or scanning.
Properly use phone equipment, including Listen/Talk back functions, transferring phone calls to appropriate personnel whether they are in house or in the field, send phone call to voicemail, conference two phone calls together when necessary, and following all written guidelines and procedures in regards to proper phone call etiquette.
Understands basic functions of alarm equipment as outlined in GCS Training Guide. Assists subscribers with basic technical questions/needs utilizing DICE and or Tech Help as well as performing successful downloading of panels upon request.
Exhibits professional behavior with all interactions, internal and external. Presents All‐Guard/Grand Central Station in a positive light at all times.
Maintains open communication with management including training needs, morale, and other basic employee issues.
Meets all deadlines as assigned.

Minimum Qualifications:
The following are the minimum qualifications an individual needs in order to successfully perform the duties and responsibilities of this position. Please note that the minimum qualifications may vary based upon the department and/or geographic location.
Skills and abilities:
Ability to function as an effective team member
Strong customer service orientation
Knowledge and ability to utilize 24‐hour time format
Ability to work day, swing, graveyard, and rotating shifts, holiday, weekends and overtime as needed.
Ability to read and follow written instructions
Ability to follow verbal instructions
Ability to communicate clearly and concisely both verbally and in writing.
Ability to meet deadlines
Ability to solve practical problems and carry out responsibility with minimum direction.
Ability to prioritize multitask responsibilities.
Computer Literacy
Physical Demands:
In general, the following physical demands are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.
Must be able to see, hear, speak, and write clearly to communicate with employees, customers, and/or vendors; manual dexterity required for occasional reaching and lifting of small objects, and operating office equipment. Must be able to walk up two flights of stairs to get to work‐station.
Work Environment:
In general, the following conditions of the work environment are representative of those that an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job.
The office is clean, orderly, properly lit and ventilated. Noise levels are considered low to moderate.

employer.name: Storer Transportation
employer.briefDescription: Join our 70+ year, 4th-gen CA family. Not a corporation. We offer secure careers, paid training, full benefits & a perfect safety record. Be valued, be secure. Apply today!

description.text:
*Hours: Monday – Friday 11:30 am to 8 pm and rotating Saturdays 10 am to 4 pm *

*Pay: $23.92 - $27.73 DOE *

*OPERATING HOURS: *

Open Monday- Friday 5:15am – 8:00pm – Saturday 10:30am – 4:00pm (subject to change based on Division needs).
Overtime based on Division needs.

Attendance of various mandatory meetings and training as required.

Must be flexible and versatile for shift change and/or coverage.

*POSITION SUMMARY:*

Under general supervision the Dispatcher will ensure the efficient operation of Tuolumne County Transit services, which may include extra public transportation services requested by Tuolumne County staff and Storer. The dispatch position is considered a supervisory position to front line employees and strict confidentiality rules apply. Dispatch “assumes a management role during non-normal business hours”.

Dispatch duties include providing excellent customer service, accurately scheduling trips, efficient routing, operates communication equipment, scheduling software system, a web-based software and tracking system, GPS software, system for senior client records, Google sheets, etc. Ability to trouble shoot issues with dispatch terminal software systems. Optimal monitoring of routes in service and road conditions. Responds to requests for service promptly and provides a variety of information to passengers and the public. Communication is essential. Dispatchers must be clear and effective using two-way radio, telephone, and verbal and written instructions. Dispatchers must be able to read, comprehend and retain information. Rely on accessible information, experience, and judgment to plan and accomplish goals. Ensure duties are completed accurately and delivered of a high quality in a timely manner.

*ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS, MAJOR DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:*

* Provide excellent customer service.
* Provide dispatching, and routing services to seniors, disabled individuals as certified under the American with Disabilities Act (ADA) and all public, dispatch fixed routes, micro transit, and paratransit vehicles as appropriate.
* Create, maintain, and monitor computerized daily schedules for dispatching and routing transit services; modify and update to improve services constantly.
* Monitor computer and two-way radio for information regarding scheduling issues and field situations; notify Safety Team and management of any situation requiring attention.
* Receive, screen, maintain, and update rider applications.
* Input and report issues with vehicles to maintenance.
* Assign drivers to various types of driving assignments
* Maintain and file records. Assist in the completion of required reporting.
* Provide route information to the public.
* Collect fares from routes, ensuring accuracy and records of each transaction
* Assist in record keeping and distributing all passes, and tickets.
* Maximize on-time performance by supervising reservations.
* Perform other related duties as assigned.
* Contribute to a harmonious and effective work environment

*KNOWLEDGE AND ABILITIES*

· Proper English grammar, punctuation, composition, vocabulary, and oral expression.

· Methods and techniques of delivering public transportation and paratransit services to seniors, disabled persons certified under the ADA, and all public.

· Methods and techniques of dispatching commercial passenger vehicles.

· Modern office procedures, methods and equipment including computers.

· Principles and procedures of record keeping.

· Dispatching techniques with the use of two-way radio systems for communicating and receiving information. Use of scheduling software.

· Thorough understanding of service area and best possible routing (streets, landmarks, and geography of Tuolumne County).

· Pertinent federal, state and local laws, codes and regulations governing public transportation for seniors and individuals certified under the ADA.

· Professionality and productivity work with others as a team.

· Performance of assigned duties with a positive attitude and in the spirit of teamwork, collaboration, and cooperation.

*Ability to:*

· Create and maintain a detailed schedule for providing dispatching services.

· Assist management with developing driver and staff schedules by offering suggestions and communicating needs and service demands.

· Effectively monitor and update daily schedules especially during unforeseen circumstances.

· Respond in a courteous manner to requests and inquiries.

· Provide exceptional customer service.

· Effectively handle difficult and sensitive inquiries and complaints.

· Supervise drivers and customer service representatives.

· Understand and follow oral and written instructions including email correspondence.

· Operate office equipment including two-way radios, computers, phones, and Dispatching systems.

· Adapt to changing technologies and learn functionality of new equipment and systems.

· Perform a wide variety of general clerical duties.

· Maintain accurate and complete records of transportation services.

· Communicate clearly and concisely, both orally and in writing.

· Establish and maintain effective working relationships with all those contacted in the course of work.

· Work efficiently in a fast-paced environment with frequent interruptions.

· Must be able to manage multiple responsibilities.

· Ability to multitask

· Must follow HIPPA guidelines, company policies, and training regarding company and public privacy. Confidentiality is of the most importance due to a wide range of personal information obtained.

· Ability to remain calm while under pressure.

*POSITION QUALIFICATIONS*

· Minimum of one (1) year as a commercial driver preferred, but not

required.

· Experience supervising employees

· Subject to DOT Drug and Alcohol Testing.

· High School Diploma or GED.

*LICENSES AND CERTIFICATES*

· Class “B” Commercial License with and passenger endorsement (will train)

· GPPV (General Public Para-Transit Vehicle) certificate and VTT (Verification of Transit Training) certificate or ability to obtain.

· DOT (Department of Transportation) medical card

· First aid and CPR certified (will train).

*PHYSICAL DEMANDS*

· Dexterity of hands and fingers to operate a variety of standard office equipment and a commercial vehicle.

· Reaching overhead, above the shoulders and horizontally, to retrieve or store office equipment or files and perform commercial driving duties.

· Clarity of vision at varying distances to be able to monitor office visitors, bus drivers, and to operate a computer and other office equipment.

· Verbal, auditory, and written capabilities to effectively communicate in an articulate manner.

· Physical ability to lift and carry up to 60 pounds, as well as bend, stoop, push/pull, twist and turn.

· Physical ability to walk on uneven terrain and board Paratransit / Transit buses.

· Sitting or standing for extended periods of time.

\*\*\*This position is a “safety sensitive” position which is subject to all FTA D&A testing requirements.

This list of essential functions and physical requirements is not exhaustive and may be supplemented as necessary in accordance with the requirements of the job. Storer adheres to the provisions of ADA regarding reasonable accommodation procedures.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $23.92 - $27.73 per hour

Benefits:
* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Work Location: In person

Dispatchers must be clear and effective using two-way radio, telephone, and verbal and written instructions. Dispatchers must be able to read, comprehend and retain information. Rely on accessible information, experience, and judgment to plan and accomplish goals. Ensure duties are completed accurately and delivered of a high quality in a timely manner.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS, MAJOR DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Provide excellent customer service.
  • Provide dispatching, and routing services to seniors, disabled individuals as certified under the American with Disabilities Act (ADA) and all public, dispatch fixed routes, micro transit, and paratransit vehicles as appropriate.
  • Create, maintain, and monitor computerized daily schedules for dispatching and routing transit services; modify and update to improve services constantly.
  • Monitor computer and two-way radio for information regarding scheduling issues and field situations; notify Safety Team and management of any situation requiring attention.
  • Receive, screen, maintain, and update rider applications.
  • Input and report issues with vehicles to maintenance.
  • Assign drivers to various types of driving assignments
  • Maintain and file records. Assist in the completion of required reporting.
  • Provide route information to the public.
  • Collect fares from routes, ensuring accuracy and records of each transaction
  • Assist in record keeping and distributing all passes, and tickets.
  • Maximize on-time performance by supervising reservations.
  • Perform other related duties as assigned.
  • Contribute to a harmonious and effective work environment

KNOWLEDGE AND ABILITIES

· Proper English grammar, punctuation, composition, vocabulary, and oral expression.

· Methods and techniques of delivering public transportation and paratransit services to seniors, disabled persons certified under the ADA, and all public.

· Methods and techniques of dispatching commercial passenger vehicles.

· Modern office procedures, methods and equipment including computers.

· Principles and procedures of record keeping.

· Dispatching techniques with the use of two-way radio systems for communicating and receiving information. Use of scheduling software.

· Thorough understanding of service area and best possible routing (streets, landmarks, and geography of Tuolumne County).

· Pertinent federal, state and local laws, codes and regulations governing public transportation for seniors and individuals certified under the ADA.

· Professionality and productivity work with others as a team.

· Performance of assigned duties with a positive attitude and in the spirit of teamwork, collaboration, and cooperation.

Ability to:

· Create and maintain a detailed schedule for providing dispatching services.

· Assist management with developing driver and staff schedules by offering suggestions and communicating needs and service demands.

· Effectively monitor and update daily schedules especially during unforeseen circumstances.

· Respond in a courteous manner to requests and inquiries.

· Provide exceptional customer service.

· Effectively handle difficult and sensitive inquiries and complaints.

· Supervise drivers and customer service representatives.

· Understand and follow oral and written instructions including email correspondence.

· Operate office equipment including two-way radios, computers, phones, and Dispatching systems.

· Adapt to changing technologies and learn functionality of new equipment and systems.

· Perform a wide variety of general clerical duties.

· Maintain accurate and complete records of transportation services.

· Communicate clearly and concisely, both orally and in writing.

· Establish and maintain effective working relationships with all those contacted in the course of work.

· Work efficiently in a fast-paced environment with frequent interruptions.

· Must be able to manage multiple responsibilities.

· Ability to multitask

· Must follow HIPPA guidelines, company policies, and training regarding company and public privacy. Confidentiality is of the most importance due to a wide range of personal information obtained.

· Ability to remain calm while under pressure.

POSITION QUALIFICATIONS

· Minimum of one (1) year as a commercial driver preferred, but not

required.

· Experience supervising employees

· Subject to DOT Drug and Alcohol Testing.

· High School Diploma or GED.

LICENSES AND CERTIFICATES

· Class “B” Commercial License with and passenger endorsement (will train)

· GPPV (General Public Para-Transit Vehicle) certificate and VTT (Verification of Transit Training) certificate or ability to obtain.

· DOT (Department of Transportation) medical card

· First aid and CPR certified (will train).

PHYSICAL DEMANDS

· Dexterity of hands and fingers to operate a variety of standard office equipment and a commercial vehicle.

· Reaching overhead, above the shoulders and horizontally, to retrieve or store office equipment or files and perform commercial driving duties.

· Clarity of vision at varying distances to be able to monitor office visitors, bus drivers, and to operate a computer and other office equipment.

· Verbal, auditory, and written capabilities to effectively communicate in an articulate manner.

· Physical ability to lift and carry up to 60 pounds, as well as bend, stoop, push/pull, twist and turn.

· Physical ability to walk on uneven terrain and board Paratransit / Transit buses.

· Sitting or standing for extended periods of time.

***This position is a “safety sensitive” position which is subject to all FTA D&A testing requirements.

This list of essential functions and physical requirements is not exhaustive and may be supplemented as necessary in accordance with the requirements of the job. Storer adheres to the provisions of ADA regarding reasonable accommodation procedures.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $23.92 - $27.73 per hour

Benefits:

  • 401(k)
  • Dental insurance
  • Health insurance
  • Paid time off
  • Vision insurance

Work Location: In person

description.text:
*Position Summary*

The Service Administrator & Dispatcher supports the day-to-day operations of the Service Department by coordinating technician schedules, assisting customers, and managing administrative tasks. This position requires strong organizational skills, excellent communication, and the ability to work in a fast-paced environment.

*Main Job Tasks & Responsibilities*

*Dispatch & Scheduling*

* Schedule and dispatch technicians for plumbing, HVAC, and maintenance calls
* Monitor job status and communicate updates between technicians, customers, and management
* Reassign technicians as needed to prioritize urgent or time-sensitive calls
* Review and close work orders accurately and timely

*Customer & Technician Support*

* Answer inbound service calls and route them appropriately
* Serve as the primary contact for customers regarding scheduling, job updates, and follow-up
* Provide support and clear communication to field technicians throughout the day

*Administrative Support*

* Create and maintain service work orders, quotes, and job notes
* Assist with daily reporting, technician time entry, and invoice preparation
* Maintain electronic and hard-copy filing systems
* Perform general clerical duties including photocopying, scanning, mailing, and data entry
* Order office and field supplies for the department
* Coordinate lunches or meeting setups for visitors, customers, or training sessions

*Data, Reporting & Coordination*

* Track contract work, PM schedules, and customer service agreements
* Prepare weekly service activity reports
* Assist the Service Manager with special projects as assigned

*Skills & Abilities*

* Strong scheduling and dispatching skills
* Excellent verbal and written communication
* Ability to multitask and stay organized in a fast-paced environment
* High attention to detail and accuracy
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Outlook, Excel, Word)
* Experience with construction or service software (Sage/Timberline) a plus
* Strong customer service, professionalism, and problem-solving abilities

*Physical Requirements*

* May require prolonged periods of sitting
* Occasional lifting, bending, or reaching

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $20.00 - $25.00 per hour

Benefits:
* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Work Location: In person

description.text:
*Dispatch & Field Operations Coordinator*

*Summary*

Brannon Corporation is seeking a Dispatch & Field Operations Coordinator to support its rapid business growth. The Field Operations Coordinator supports the Project Management and Field Leadership Teams by ensuring accurate, organized, and timely coordination of daily field operations. This position plays a key role in keeping crews, equipment, materials, and documentation aligned to project needs, balancing such needs with budget and cost limitations. The ideal candidate is a highly organized, detail-oriented professional who thrives in a fast-paced construction environment and enjoys solving logistical challenges. This role is an excellent opportunity for someone looking to grow into dispatch, project administration, or operations management within the construction industry.

*Key Results*

* *Seamless Field Coordination* - Daily crew, equipment, and material assignments are communicated accurately and on time.
* *Reliable Recordkeeping & Communication* - Operational data, logs, and updates are consistently maintained and shared with accuracy.
* *Support for Resource Planning* - Assist the Project Management and Field Leadership teams with data and documentation needed to optimize resource deployment and cost efficiency.
* *Clear Weekly Reporting* - Ensure Field operations metrics and updates are tracked, summarized, and shared to inform team decisions.

*Key Responsibilities*

*Field Coordination & Logistics*

* Support daily scheduling and mobilization of field crews, equipment, and trucking in coordination with the Project Management and Field Leadership teams.
* Confirm project readiness by verifying site access, material deliveries, permits, and safety requirements.
* Track crew and equipment movements across job sites and communicate updates promptly to field leads.
* Maintain accurate daily logs of field activity, delivery receipts, and trucking records.

*Communication & Documentation*

* Dispatch support to serve as a communication bridge between field teams, vendors, and office staff.
* Ensure all field coordination updates are entered into *HCSS Dispatcher* and related tracking systems.
* Maintain shared calendars, schedules, and contact lists to support resource planning.
* Assist with preparing daily and weekly field operations reports.

*Vendor & Administrative Support*

* Coordinate with vendors for equipment rentals, deliveries, and trucking orders.
* Verify truck tags, tickets, and invoices for accuracy before submission.
* Maintain updated vendor rate sheets and service records.
* Assist with job cost tracking, timesheet collection, and data entry.

*Safety & Compliance*

* Track crew certifications, training expirations, and safety meeting attendance in collaboration with HR and the Safety team.
* Ensure field documentation complies with company and regulatory requirements.
* Assist in reporting safety incidents or near-misses as directed.

*Process Improvement & Technology Utilization*

* Continually improve dispatch procedures and processes to maximize efficiency.
* Leverage technology and software solutions to streamline scheduling and tracking.
* Assist with various dispatch duties as needed, with flexibility to adapt based on company needs.

*Position Requirements*

*Required*

* Associate degree in Business, Construction Management, or related field
* 2+ years of administrative or field coordination experience, ideally in construction, logistics, or operations.
* Strong proficiency in Microsoft Office (Excel, Outlook, Word).
* Experience with HCSS Dispatcher or similar logistics software
* Excellent organizational and multitasking skills in a fast-paced environment.
* Strong written and verbal communication skills.
* Valid California Driver's License and reliable transportation.
* Demonstrated history of professional integrity

*Preferred*

* Familiarity with construction operations, equipment types, and basic job cost tracking.
* Bilingual (English/Spanish) strongly preferred.
* Knowledge of construction equipment, industry terminology, and labor unions

Pay: $28.00 - $30.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Benefits:
* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Work Location: In person

description.text:
About Us

Here at LAZ Parking, we often say, it’s not what we do, it's the way we do it. We are more than just the fastest-growing and largest privately held parking company in the country. We believe that the work we do and how we treat people can really make a difference.

LAZ provides a reliable transportation service with a commitment to safety while maintaining the highest standards of professionalism and excellence in our operations.

We are currently seeking experienced a dedicated Shuttle Operations Manager to join our team!

Why LAZ?

$80,000-$95,000 or DOE
Growth Opportunities
Competitive Pay/Wages
Health, dental, and vision insurance options
401k Retirement savings plan
Paid time off and holidays
Opportunities for advancement and professional development

The Spirit of the Position:

The Shuttle Operations Manager will oversee daily shuttle operations and ensure the overall operational success of shuttle services during afternoons, evenings, and weekends. This includes ensuring smooth shuttle operations and promoting excellent customer service.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

The duties and responsibilities of the Operations Manager will include but are not limited to the following:

Shuttle Operations:
Oversee daily shuttle operations, ensuring timely, safe, and efficient transportation for passengers.
Support the team in managing shuttle operations ensuring optimal utilization and customer satisfaction.
Personnel Management:
Manage hourly staff including Supervisors, Dispatchers, Shuttle Drivers, and Maintenance staff.
Foster teamwork, motivate employees, and implement corrective actions to enforce policies and procedures.
Assist in hiring, training, and evaluating shuttle employees, ensuring adherence to LAZ standards.
Promote “The LAZ Way” (Motto, Values, & Practices).
Scheduling and Resource Allocation:
Create and monitor daily schedules for shuttle services, including work assignments and meal breaks.
Ensure adequate staffing levels to meet service standards, adjusting the schedule as needed.
Review and approve time off requests and monitor adherence to operational and personnel policies.
Fleet and Facility Management:
Manage fleet maintenance and cleaning schedules, ensuring vehicles are operational and safe.
Perform routine inventory of supplies and equipment, ensuring staff have the necessary tools for their roles.
Conduct monthly facility and vehicle safety inspections, addressing any deficiencies promptly.
Safety and Compliance:
Ensure all employees adhere to safety standards, promoting workplace safety and compliance with DOT and ADA regulations.
Oversee monthly driver evaluations conducted by the Safety Manager and support safety initiatives.
Customer Service and Operational Excellence:
Maintain high levels of customer service, ensuring all shuttle and parking services meet or exceed expectations.
Process daily reports on passenger counts, headways, and other operational metrics.
Address customer inquiries and resolve complaints in a professional and efficient manner.
Leadership and Team Development:
Set individualized employee goals and track their progress.
Support LAZ U training and employee development initiatives in collaboration with HR and the HRBP.
Other Duties:
Participate in internal meetings as needed and perform additional tasks as assigned by the PM, DOO, and GM.

REQUIREMENTS:

Valid Class A or B license with air brake and passenger endorsements
Three (3) years’ experience in a commercial transportation or paratransit operation
Two (2) years management experience in the parking or transportation industry
Pre-employment background check and drug screening
Clean DMV MVR
Familiarity with DOT rules and regulations
Familiarity with ADA rules and regulations

EDUCATION:

Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent work experience.

EXPERIENCE:

Must have excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Experience managing a team of 20+ employees.
Intermediate proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Outlook).
Familiarity with telematics systems, including cameras and GPS devices.

SKILLS:

Ability to problem-solve in challenging situations, such as malfunctioning technology, staffing shortages, or unplanned operational changes.
Strong customer service and interpersonal skills to handle sensitive and complex situations.
Excellent team-building and leadership skills.
Ability to train, coach, and develop frontline employees.
Ability to work independently, multi-task, and communicate effectively with all levels of the organization.

Physical Demands:

Ability to push/pull/lift up to 50 lbs.
Ability to bend, squat, and perform physical tasks throughout the shift.
Willingness to work in various weather conditions (rain, snow, heat, high winds, etc.).

FLSA Status: Non-Exempt

To be hired, all candidates must submit to a background check and pre-employment drug screen.

LAZ Parking is an equal opportunity employer. In all our employment practices, including hiring, we are firmly committed to provide equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons, regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, age, genetics, Vietnam era, special disabled, recently separated and other protected veterans, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. No question in our application process is used for the process of limiting or excluding any applicant's consideration for employment on such grounds.

This Employer participates in E-Verify.

description.text:
*Summary of Position:*

The shipping and receiving dispatcher be responsible for receiving, checking, and recording incoming shipments of various materials and products. Other tasks will be assigned based on daily department needs. This role requires the ability to work within a flexible work schedule.

*Essential Duties for all Employees:*

· Maintain a clean and safe work environment that promotes work safety and product integrity.

· You must follow all Safety, HACCP & GMP requirements always.

· Adaptable to a fast-paced environment.

· Willing to be flexible to accommodate changing business conditions.

*Job Specific Duties & Responsibilities:*

· Schedule inbound and outbound appointments in Open Dock

· Create inventory transfers daily to outside warehouses.

· Forklift driver assignments and HANA batch assignments

· Run query report to track outbound shipments and close outbound shipments.

· Work with procurement on inbound schedules and discrepancies.

· Review incoming shipments and verify receipts and documents for accuracy and completeness.

· Validate PO against BOLs and packing slips for accuracy.

· Investigate all discrepancies discovered during audit, not limited to overages, shortages, and damage (OSD) with suppliers/carriers.

· Inspect all contents for damage and volume.

· Ensures timeliness and accuracy of transactions recorded in SAP.

· Generate reports and perform analytics from SAP.

· Will be required to monitor incoming purchase orders to ensure timely delivery on materials.

· Will be required to communicate receiving discrepancies (damaged, count, etc.).

· Performs routine clerical duties, including data entry, printing labels, etc. as necessary.

· Participate in monthly internal audits.

· Conducts daily, weekly, and monthly inventory counts (raw, chemical, and packaging) and daily freezer counts.

· Inspection of Inbound Raw delivery and report any Raw out of spec.

· Inspect all gray bins upon receipt and report on damaged bins received.

*Qualifications:*

· High school diploma and minimum of 2 years of experience

· Knowledge of inventory handling, receiving and control practices is a plus.

· SAP, HANA experience a plus and strong math skills

· Bilingual, Spanish a plus

· Microsoft Office Suite experience

· Ablet to work overtime and weekends as needed.

*Working Conditions:*

· Exposure to weather, extreme heat, Wet and/or humid environment

· Noise & Vibration

· Moving mechanical parts

· Exposed to onsite chemicals.

*Other Duties:*

Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.
*Compensation:*

The final determination of a successful candidate's starting pay will vary based on several factors, including market location, job-related knowledge, skills, education, and experience. The pay scale listed for this position is generally for candidates that meet the specified qualifications and requirements listed on this specific job description. Our goal is to provide competitive pay that recognizes your experience, credentials, and education alongside our benefits program to meet your needs.

*Equal Employment Opportunity:*

George Chiala Farms, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $23.75 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Benefits:
* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Health savings account
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Work Location: In person

· Participate in monthly internal audits.

· Conducts daily, weekly, and monthly inventory counts (raw, chemical, and packaging) and daily freezer counts.

· Inspection of Inbound Raw delivery and report any Raw out of spec.

· Inspect all gray bins upon receipt and report on damaged bins received.

Qualifications:

· High school diploma and minimum of 2 years of experience

· Knowledge of inventory handling, receiving and control practices is a plus.

· SAP, HANA experience a plus and strong math skills

· Bilingual, Spanish a plus

· Microsoft Office Suite experience

· Ablet to work overtime and weekends as needed.

Working Conditions:

· Exposure to weather, extreme heat, Wet and/or humid environment

· Noise & Vibration

· Moving mechanical parts

· Exposed to onsite chemicals.

Other Duties:

Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

The final determination of a successful candidate's starting pay will vary based on several factors, including market location, job-related knowledge, skills, education, and experience. The pay scale listed for this position is generally for candidates that meet the specified qualifications and requirements listed on this specific job description. Our goal is to provide competitive pay that recognizes your experience, credentials, and education alongside our benefits program to meet your needs.

description.text:
*Job Summary*
We are seeking a detail-oriented and organized Dispatcher to coordinate towing, transportation and Battery Techs operations within our network. The ideal candidate will manage incoming call movements, communicate effectively with drivers and clients, and utilize transportation management systems to ensure timely deliveries. This role is vital in optimizing fleet utilization, maintaining accurate data entry, and supporting overall transportation planning. The Dispatcher will play a key role in ensuring daily processes and maintaining high standards of communication and efficiency across all activities.

*Responsibilities*

* Coordinate and schedule incoming calls using management systems.
* Utilize GPS tools for route planning, tracking, and optimization to enhance transportation efficiency.
* Manage dispatching activities for fleet management, including assigning drivers, monitoring vehicle locations, and adjusting routes as needed.
* Oversee call order operations, ensuring accurate documentation and timely processing in each call.
* Maintain data entry accuracy in log book and software platforms.
* Communicate effectively with drivers, customers, members, and internal teams via multi-line phone systems while demonstrating professional phone etiquette.
* Analyze transportation data to identify opportunities for process improvements.

*Skills*

* Proficiency in call volume and transportation management.
* Strong knowledge of GPS technology, and transportation planning tools.
* Experience in call center, fleet management, and dispatching processes.
* Excellent analysis skills for route optimization and operational improvements.
* Effective dispatching skills combined with strong communication abilities and phone etiquette.
* Data entry expertise with dispatching software platforms
* Ability to multitask effectively using multi-line phone systems while maintaining professionalism.
* Knowledge of automotive and transportation management best practices.
* Strong typing skills for efficient data entry and documentation. This position offers an engaging opportunity to contribute to our dispatching team by ensuring smooth transportation operations through effective dispatching, strategic planning, and excellent communication skills.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $18.00 - $20.00 per hour

Benefits:
* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

People with a criminal record are encouraged to apply

Work Location: In person

description.text:
Central Station Dispatcher - DAY SHIFT

Timing: 5:30 am to 2:00pm.

Position Overview:
The Central Station Dispatcher is the initial contact for dispatching emergency and non‐ emergency resources (public safety, alarm company personnel, responsible parties) and is responsible for managing the flow of incident related information to and from said resources. This position reports to the Central Station Manager/Central Station Assistant Manager/Shift Supervisor. The Central Station Dispatcher may be assigned additional tasks or duties by the Central Station Shift Supervisor and/or Central Station Manager and Assistant Manager.

Key duties & Responsibilities:
Please note the essential functions may vary depending on department size, organizational structure and/or geographic location.
Receive information from multiple sources requiring dispatch of emergency and/or non‐emergency resources.
Exhibit the knowledge to competently process alarm conditions as received, processing highest priority alarms first. Alarms will be processed consistently in accordance with departmental policy as outlined in GCS Training Guide and/or written memos or procedures.
Enter, update, and monitor the status of incidents via DICE, Immix by SureView or Frontel.
Properly, politely and diplomatically communicate necessary information to subscribers, emergency agencies, responsible persons, and the alarm companies using GCS approved customer service skills and phraseology or script.
Qualified to input a basic, uncomplicated account into DICE.
Receive and interpret verbal and written instructions to create new accounts. Receive temporary information changes from subscribers and Alarm Companies. Enter received data into the account file or forward information to data entry personnel for input.
Understand all of the operations of DICE alarm monitoring software in accordance with granted level of access. 1. Completing alarm events; manual alarm generation, creating, printing and completing service tickets, viewing reports of history. 2. Searching for accounts; placing accounts on test, writing account notes, entering O/C temporary schedules, viewing accounts and dealer accounts, exiting DICE. 3. Edit/Update Accounts: change account numbers, print/fax/email reports, dictate, compose, and complete edit requests.
Maintain filing or scanning of account paperwork. Working in conjunction with appropriate guidelines and procedures for filing and/or scanning.
Properly use phone equipment, including Listen/Talk back functions, transferring phone calls to appropriate personnel whether they are in house or in the field, send phone call to voicemail, conference two phone calls together when necessary, and following all written guidelines and procedures in regards to proper phone call etiquette.
Understands basic functions of alarm equipment as outlined in GCS Training Guide. Assists subscribers with basic technical questions/needs utilizing DICE and or Tech Help as well as performing successful downloading of panels upon request.
Exhibits professional behavior with all interactions, internal and external. Presents All‐Guard/Grand Central Station in a positive light at all times.
Maintains open communication with management including training needs, morale, and other basic employee issues.
Meets all deadlines as assigned.

Minimum Qualifications:
The following are the minimum qualifications an individual needs in order to successfully perform the duties and responsibilities of this position. Please note that the minimum qualifications may vary based upon the department and/or geographic location.
Skills and abilities:
Ability to function as an effective team member
Strong customer service orientation
Knowledge and ability to utilize 24‐hour time format
Ability to work day, swing, graveyard, and rotating shifts, holiday, weekends and overtime as needed.
Ability to read and follow written instructions
Ability to follow verbal instructions
Ability to communicate clearly and concisely both verbally and in writing.
Ability to meet deadlines
Ability to solve practical problems and carry out responsibility with minimum direction.
Ability to prioritize multitask responsibilities.
Computer Literacy
Physical Demands:
In general, the following physical demands are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.
Must be able to see, hear, speak, and write clearly to communicate with employees, customers, and/or vendors; manual dexterity required for occasional reaching and lifting of small objects, and operating office equipment. Must be able to walk up two flights of stairs to get to work‐station.
Work Environment:
In general, the following conditions of the work environment are representative of those that an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job.
The office is clean, orderly, properly lit and ventilated. Noise levels are considered low to moderate.

description.text:
Amador Valley Industries, a Waste Connections company, is looking to hire a full time Dispatcher at our location in Livermore, CA!

The schedule will be subject to change but will most likely be Monday-Friday 7am-4pm. Occasional Saturday work during holiday season.

Starting pay will be $27-28 per hour, depending on experience. The pay range for this job category is $27-29 per hour.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

Work in conjunction with other departments to resolve customer disputes & demonstrate the ability to become proficient in the use of proprietary operational systems.
Analyzing and resolving customer inquiries for missed pick-ups, misplaced containers and property damage.
Assisting driver(s) when a pick up or delivery is in question before servicing.
Scheduling and dispatching work to various employees and departments throughout the day.
Demonstrate effective use of software applications, at a minimum MS Word and Excel proficient.
Delivers services to customers in a manner that promotes goodwill. Interacts with customers daily.
Work in a fast paced, cooperative, high call volume environment.
Multitasking large amounts of data entry, while maintaining high volume radio traffic and internal employee interaction.
Quickly and confidentially make decisions, often without managerial approval.

MINIMUM JOB REQUIREMENTS:

2 years of Dispatcher experience in a transportation or logistics atmosphere preferred.
Strong typing skills
Must have working knowledge of MS Office Suite (Excel, Word, Outlook, Etc)
Excellent organization and communication skills, both orally and written.

To be considered for any of our current openings you must complete an application at www.wasteconnections.com. Application information and additional instructions can be found once you select your position of interest.

We offer excellent benefits including: medical, dental, vision, flexible spending account, long term & short term disability, life insurance, 401K retirement and unlimited opportunities to "Connect with Your Future".

Waste Connections is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to disability or protected veteran status.

description.text:
Location: Livermore, CA, USA

Shift: 2nd Shift

Work model: On-Site

Schedule: FULLTIME; Sun - Tues, every other Wed, 3:00 p.m. - 3:00 a.m.

Job overview:

Schneider is seeking a Traffic Coordinator in Livermore, CA to create, monitor, and complete inbound/outbound shipments within the Transportation Management System. This individual will also be accountable to ensure that inbound/outbound shipment service improvements are made to exceed the expectations of the customer.

Responsibilities:

Responsible for tracking, tracing, and expediting lost moves.
Point of contact for Dedicated Delivery Service provider.
Coordinate all shipping needs for primary inbound/outbound carriers.
Handle the non-parcel orders. Accountable for preparing all necessary paperwork and documentation.

Skills and qualifications:

High School/GED or equivalent work experience.
Two plus years of relevant experience.
Problem solving skills, strong communication, and ability to work in a diverse and dynamic team.
Must be able to lift up to 50 (lbs) and withstand prolong periods of walking and/or standing.

Pay and benefits:

Medical, dental and vision insurance.
Company paid life insurance.
401(k) savings plan with company match.
Paid time off and paid holidays.
Results-based incentive pay program where you can earn above and beyond your base pay.
Starting wage of $23.50 - 29.40 / hour. Additional $1.25/hr (a minimum of 4 continuous hours worked between the hours of 1600-0500 local time) or $2.00/hr (weekend hours worked between 2100 Friday and 0500 Monday)
Tuition reimbursement.
See full list of benefits.

Schneider's inclusive culture

Our history has taught us that treating everyone with dignity and respect is vital to our ongoing success. We embrace and seek out diversity that is inclusive of thought, race, ethnicity, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, age, religion, sexual orientation, ability, medical condition, veteran or military status, experience and background. This diversity and openness ensures all associates have equal access to opportunities and resources to contribute fully to the organization's success, and it fuels innovation, improves strategic thinking and cultivates leadership. Any applicant may request a reasonable accommodation to complete a job application, pre-employment testing, or job interview or to otherwise participate in the hiring process consistent with the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) by contacting their Recruiter, Human Resources Business Partner, and/or Human Resources Leave Administration.

title: PACE Transportation Supervisor (Central Valley PACE - Modesto)

employer.name: Golden Valley Health Centers
employer.briefDescription: Our mission is to improve the health of our patients by providing quality, primary health care services.

attributes.BE5F5: Experience with individuals with cognitive disabilities

description.text:
Under the general supervision of the PACE Transportation Manager and Director, plans, organizes and implements the transportation services of the day health center.

Location: Modesto, Ca.

Schedule : Monday - Friday, 8:00am - 5:00pm.

Compensation: Compensation: $69,908.80 - $73,404.24

Duties and Responsibilities

Plans and coordinates all scheduling activities related to transportation for Central Valley PACE participants.
Supervises daily, the activities of the coordinator, drivers and aides.
Responsible for coordination of all outside service providers of transportation.
Reviews and verifies all bills for services provided by outside contractors.
Assures all necessary program records are maintained according to policy.
Participates as a member of the Interdisciplinary Team (IDT). Attends staff meetings and takes part in participant care planning.
Coach and counsel staff and administer appropriate disciplinary action in a timely manner.
Participating in performance reviews, monitoring budgetary practices, preparing staff schedules, developing and implementing performance improvement activities and providing off-hours administrative and in-person support.
Conduct system-wide analysis of transportation operations to ensure efficiency.
Coordinate resources across staff and contracted vendors and engage with vendors based on contractual thresholds, and reprioritize participant trips.
Maintaining and communicating policies and procedures clearly.
Makes adjustments to routes/trips on short notice and communicate changes.
Investigate participant/caregiver complaints and escalate to the quality team when necessary.
Model and promote service excellence and respectful relationships with participants, caregivers, and staff.
Observe each participant for any change in physical, mental, emotional and social functioning and shall report such changes to the licensed nurse.
Assists passengers on and off the van in a safe and courteous manner. Will work with medical equipment and manage other emergencies that may arise.
Ensures vehicle inspection logs are maintained and required maintenance completed.
Ability to interact professionally and respectfully with geriatric individuals including those with cognitive decline and/or physical frailties.
Trains drivers on established processes and test for competencies.
Participates in continuous improvement activities and use lean tools to measure results.
Serves as a backup driver as necessary.
Communicates scheduling to essential transportation team members to ensure all routes are appropriately scheduled.
Other projects and duties as assigned.

Physical Demands

Ability to lift up to 30 pounds. Moving, lifting or transferring patients may involve lifting or pushing greater than 30 pounds, should be done with assistance as appropriate.
Must be able to hear staff on the phone and those who are served in-person, and speak clearly in order to communicate information to clients and staff.
Must have vision with or without lenses that is adequate to read memos, a computer screen, personnel forms and clinical and administrative documents.
Must have high manual dexterity.
Must be able to reach above the shoulder level to work, must be able to bend, squat and sit, stand, stoop, crouching, reaching, kneeling, twisting/turning, fingering and feeling.

Work Environment

Exposure to biohazards, including infectious material and waste and any other conditions common in a health care environment.
Subject to unpleasant odors.
Exposed to outdoor elements of heat, cold and rain when transporting patients.
The noise level is usually quiet to moderate, but may at times be noisy and crowded.

Education/Experience Requirements

Minimum Qualifications

Valid CA Driver's License, clean driving record, and vehicle insurance.
Current BLS CPR Card, certified by the American Heart Association or American Red Cross.
Upon hire, Defensive Driving Course will be required.
Must have good interpersonal skills and be able to work effectively in a team environment.
Meet a standardized set of competencies for the specific position description established by Central Valley PACE and approved by CMS before working independently.

Education/Experience

High School Diploma, GED, or equivalent required.
Minimum two (2) years supervisory experience required, within a transportation setting preferred.
Minimum one (1) year routing/dispatching experience.
Minimum two (2) year experience transporting individuals with special mobility needs.
Six Sigma certification, preferred.
One (1) year prior personal care assistance experience, preferred; or ability to pass internal competencies.

Equal Opportunity Employer
This employer is required to notify all applicants of their rights pursuant to federal employment laws. For further information, please review the Know Your Rights notice from the Department of Labor.
